glossary.definition: Category of interview (phone screen, video interview, onsite, panel, technical assessment)
Group of interviewers conducting an interview together (typically for onsite/final rounds)
Structured form for interviewers to provide candidate evaluation and ratings
Numerical or categorical rating given to candidate based on interview performance
Final decision from interview: Pass, Fail, Hold (needs more information)

business_rules: Interviews must be scheduled at least 24 hours in advance (no same-day scheduling)
Interviewers must provide feedback within 48 hours of interview completion
Panel interviews require at least 2 interviewers, maximum 5
Video interviews require calendar integration and video platform link generation
Technical assessments can be scheduled independently or as part of interview sequence
Interview cancellation requires 24-hour notice; last-minute cancellations are marked
Interview feedback is required before candidate can advance to next stage
Interview outcome is determined by: all interviewers pass = pass, any fail = fail, mixed = hold
Interview recordings (if enabled) require candidate consent and are stored for 90 days
Interview scheduling respects interviewer timezone and working hours
calculations_or_formulas: Interview score = average of all interviewer ratings
invariants: Interview cannot be scheduled in the past
Interviewer cannot be double-booked for overlapping time slots
Interview feedback cannot be modified after 7 days (locked for audit)
Candidate must be in appropriate pipeline stage to schedule interview
Interview date must be within job posting's active period
edge_cases: Interviewer cancels 2 hours before interview - system sends notification, attempts to find replacement, or reschedules
Multiple interviewers provide conflicting feedback (one pass, one fail) - system flags for hiring manager review
Video interview platform fails during interview - backup scheduling option or reschedule required
Candidate no-shows for interview - system marks as 'no-show', notifies recruiter, may auto-reject after 2 no-shows
Interview feedback is incomplete (missing required fields) - system blocks stage advancement until complete
Interview scheduled across timezones - system displays times in both interviewer and candidate timezones
Panel interview where one interviewer is unavailable - system allows partial panel or reschedule
Technical assessment expires before candidate completes - system allows extension request or marks incomplete
compliance_requirements: Interview recordings require explicit candidate consent (GDPR/legal requirement)
Interview feedback must be stored with timestamp and cannot be deleted (audit requirement)
Interview scheduling must comply with candidate availability and timezone preferences
Interview data must be retained for legal compliance (typically 2-3 years)
Bias mitigation: Interview feedback forms must use structured criteria, not free-form only

inputs: Interview location or video platform link

user_journeys: Recruiter schedules phone screen - system finds interviewer availability, sends calendar invites to both parties
Interviewer completes interview and submits feedback - system calculates score, updates candidate status
Candidate completes technical assessment - system scores automatically, results linked to candidate profile
Panel interview scheduled - system coordinates multiple interviewer calendars, sends group invites
Interview feedback triggers auto-advance - when all interviews pass, candidate moves to offer stage
Interview no-show - system marks candidate, notifies recruiter, may trigger auto-reject workflow
acceptance_criteria_suggestions: Given interview scheduling request, when interviewer and candidate availability matches, then interview is scheduled with calendar invites sent
Given interview completion, when all required feedback is submitted, then interview outcome is calculated and candidate status updated
Given panel interview, when at least 2 interviewers provide feedback, then outcome is determined (unanimous pass = pass, any fail = fail)
Given interview no-show, when candidate doesn't attend, then interview is marked no-show and recruiter is notified
Given technical assessment, when candidate completes within time limit, then score is calculated and linked to profile
open_questions: What is the exact interview outcome determination logic? (unanimous required? majority vote? weighted scores?)
How are interview conflicts resolved when multiple interviewers have different availability?
What happens to scheduled interviews when a candidate is rejected in a previous stage?
Are there different interview types required for different job levels? (e.g., executive vs. entry-level)
How are interview recordings stored and accessed? (cloud storage, retention policy?)
What is the process for interview feedback disputes or appeals?
assumptions: Calendar integration supports Google Calendar and Microsoft Outlook
Video interview platform integration is available (Zoom, Teams, or custom)
Interview feedback forms are customizable per job posting or interview type
Interview scheduling respects business hours and timezone preferences
Technical assessments can be integrated with third-party coding platforms (HackerRank, Codility, etc.)
